title: Multi-microphone Automatic Speech Segmentation in Meetings Based on Circular Harmonics Features. (arXiv:2306.04268v1 [cs.SD])
abstract: Speaker diarization is the task of answering Who spoke and when? in an audio stream. Pipeline systems rely on speech segmentation to extract speakers' segments and achieve robust speaker diarization. This paper proposes a common framework to solve three segmentation tasks in the distant speech scenario: Voice Activity Detection (VAD), Overlapped Speech Detection (OSD), and Speaker Change Detection (SCD). In the literature, a few studies investigate the multi-microphone distant speech scenario. In this work, we propose a new set of spatial features based on direction-of-arrival estimations in the circular harmonic domain (CH-DOA). These spatial features are extracted from multi-microphone audio data and combined with standard acoustic features. Experiments on the AMI meeting corpus show that CH-DOA can improve the segmentation while being robust in the case of deactivated microphones.

translated_title: 基于循环谐波特征的多麦克风会议语音自动分割
translated_abstract: 说话人分离是在语音流中回答“谁讲了什么”的任务。流水线系统依赖于语音分割来提取说话者的片段并实现强健的说话人分离。本文提出了一个通用框架，用于解决远程语音情况下的三个分割任务：语音活动检测(VAD)，重叠语音检测(OSD)和说话人更改检测(SCD)。在文献中，有少量研究调查了多麦克风远程语音场景。在这项工作中，我们提出了一组新的空间特征，这些特征基于循环谐波域(CH-DOA)中的到达方向估计。这些空间特征从多麦克风音频数据中提取，并与标准声学特征相结合。在AMI会议语料库上的实验证明，CH-DOA可以改善分割结果并且在麦克风停用的情况下仍然具有鲁棒性。
tldr: 本文提出了一个通用的框架来解决多麦克风远程语音场景下的三个分割任务，同时提出了一个新的基于循环谐波特征的空间特征，并结合标准声学特征来提高分割效果，实验证明这种方法具有鲁棒性。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a common framework to solve the segmentation tasks of VAD, OSD, and SCD in the multi-microphone distant speech scenario, and introduces a new set of spatial features based on circular harmonics to improve the segmentation performance, which is proven to be robust in experiments on the AMI meeting corpus.
